--- title: Circuit keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Representation of quantum circuits." description: "Representation of quantum circuits." nb_path: "02_circuit.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

A circuit is a list of ticks. A tick consists of gates associated to qubits. We can have one-qubit gates which are applied to single gate locations and two-qubit gates which are applied to an ordered (control,target)-qubit pair. For simplicity, we implement this as a list of dictionaries. Each tick is represented by a dictionary (a ticktionary if you may) which holds the gate_symbol as key and the set of qubits we want to apply these gates to as values. Qubits can be either integers for single-qubit locations or tuples for two-qubit locations.

{% raw %}

class Circuit[source]

Circuit(ticks=None) :: MutableSequence

Representation of a quantum circuit

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

As Circuit is a MutableSequence we get all the Pythonic list functionality for free. Let's check several ways we can create and add to a circuit.

{% raw %} 
circuit = Circuit([{'H': {1,2,3}}])
assert circuit._ticks == [{'H': {1,2,3}}]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
circuit.append({'X': {0,1}, 'CNOT':{(2,3)}})
assert circuit._ticks == [{'H': {1,2,3}}, {'X': {0,1}, 'CNOT':{(2,3)}}]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
circuit += [{'CNOT':{(2,3),(0,1)}}]
assert circuit._ticks == [{'H': {1,2,3}}, {'X': {0,1}, 'CNOT':{(2,3)}}, {'CNOT': {(2,3),(0,1)}}]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
circuit.pop(0)
circuit.insert(0, {'Y': {0,3}})
assert circuit._ticks == [{'Y': {0,3}}, {'X': {0,1}, 'CNOT':{(2,3)}}, {'CNOT': {(2,3),(0,1)}}]
{% endraw %}

Of course we can also print our Circuit. We get a list of ticks and the corresponding ticks which are sequentially applied to our state during simulation.

{% raw %} 
print(circuit)

0: {'Y': {0, 3}}
1: {'X': {0, 1}, 'CNOT': {(2, 3)}}
2: {'CNOT': {(2, 3), (0, 1)}}
{% endraw %}

Furthermore, our Circuit class gives us some useful information about the circuit, as

{% raw %}

Circuit.n_qubits[source]

Number of qubits used in circuit

Circuit.n_ticks[source]

Number of ticks

{% endraw %}
